title: Sans serif typefaces with Latin Extended-A character sets?
content:
Just wondering if there’s anywhere I can find a list of typefaces with Latin Extended-A character sets? Or can anyone recommend any? Preferably sans serif and with small caps.

Cheers.

 [‹ THE BEST & WORST TYPE LOGOS](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19286 "Go to previous forum topic") [Choosing a font for a book that is evocative of New York ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19846 "Go to next forum topic")
author: i0ta

comments.content: [Credo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.p22.com/rtf/Products/Credo.html) fits your specifications. (The Pro versions do anyway)

[FF Scala Sans Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11572.0.0)  
 [FF Dax Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Dax%20Pro)  
 [FF Meta Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Meta%20Pro)  
 [FF Nexus Sans Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11565.0.0)  
 [Cronos Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Cronos%20Pro)  
 [Bryant 2 Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=PRC.123371.0.0)  
 [Myriad Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Myriad%20Pro)  
 [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Proxima%20Nova)

In addition to the above suggestions, does anyone have any other suggestions for display faces that have Latin Extended-A character sets?

I know of “Klavika” ( [http://processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html "http://processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html")), but I’m looking for something more along the lines of “Transfer” by PsyOps ( [http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_transfer\_ss.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055815/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_transfer_ss.html "http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_transfer\_ss.html"))

Thanks.
